commit_message:
Add 'all_state' value to 'notify_on_state_change' option

In the configuration doc, 'notify_on_state_change' means that "If set,
send compute.instance.update notifications on instance state changes."
Valid values are None, 'vm_state' and 'vm_and_task_state'. However, in
current implementation, if it's set to 'vm_state',
compute.instance.update notifications will be sent for all the state
changes and it will be a special state change notification when the vm
state changes. So as to 'vm_and_task_state'.

This patch introduces another valid value 'all_state' to get all the
compute.instance.update notifications. And if 'vm_and_task_state' is
set, we only send update notifications when vm state or task state have
been changed. The same with 'vm_state'.

Change-Id: Idd0ede7c297821590944d8b84f7bfa308c263bda
Closes-Bug: #1535254

subject: XenAPI: Handle old and new-style SR UUIDs during live-migration
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 782, 'name': 'John Garbutt', 'email': 'john.garbutt@stackhpc.com', 'username': 'johngarbutt'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 6735, 'name': 'Bob Ball', 'email': 'bob.ball@citrix.com', 'username': 'bob-ball'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11069, 'name': 'Corey Wright', 'email': 'undefined+launchpad@pobox.com', 'username': 'coreywright'}, {'_account_id': 15286, 'name': 'XenProject CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@xenproject.org', 'username': 'XenProject-CI', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15751, 'name': 'Intel PCI CI', 'email': 'pci-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intelpcici', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15761, 'name': 'ravikamachi', 'email': 'ravi.kamachi@rackspace.com', 'username': 'ravikamachi'}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16898, 'name': 'Virtuozzo CI', 'email': 'virtuozzo6-ci@virtuozzo.com', 'username': 'virtuozzo6-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-19 02:36:30.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objects/migrate_data.py', 'nova/tests/unit/objects/test_objects.py', 'nova/virt/xenapi/driver.py', 'nova/virt/xenapi/volumeops.py', 'nova/virt/xenapi/vmops.py', 'nova/virt/xenapi/volume_utils.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/xenapi/test_volumeops.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/xenapi/test_vmops.py'], 'message': "XenAPI: Handle old and new-style SR UUIDs during live-migration

Pass the volume-to-SR UUID mapping between live-migration source and
destination instead of assuming how the SR UUID is calculated from the
volume UUID and recalculating it (wrongly, in the case of old-style SR
UUIDs).

* Add volume_to_sr_uuids to XenapiLiveMigrateData object.
* Generate volume-to-SR UUID mapping by mapping volumes in the block
  device mapping to SRs associated with mount devices (ie device ->
  VBD -> VDI -> SR), also in the BDM, during source's
  live-migrate-check.
* Pass volume-to-SR UUID mapping down to the SR UUID determination
  function during destination's pre-live-migration.

Change-Id: Ie67646605946b9a7b929e1d9f3c4d6eb4fb19471
Closes-Bug: #1566622
Co-Authored-By: John Garbutt <john.garbutt@rackspace.com>
Co-Authored-By: Bob Ball <bob.ball@citrix.com>
"}]
commit_message:
XenAPI: Handle old and new-style SR UUIDs during live-migration

Pass the volume-to-SR UUID mapping between live-migration source and
destination instead of assuming how the SR UUID is calculated from the
volume UUID and recalculating it (wrongly, in the case of old-style SR
UUIDs).

* Add volume_to_sr_uuids to XenapiLiveMigrateData object.
* Generate volume-to-SR UUID mapping by mapping volumes in the block
  device mapping to SRs associated with mount devices (ie device ->
  VBD -> VDI -> SR), also in the BDM, during source's
  live-migrate-check.
* Pass volume-to-SR UUID mapping down to the SR UUID determination
  function during destination's pre-live-migration.

Change-Id: Ie67646605946b9a7b929e1d9f3c4d6eb4fb19471
Closes-Bug: #1566622
Co-Authored-By: John Garbutt <john.garbutt@rackspace.com>
Co-Authored-By: Bob Ball <bob.ball@citrix.com>

commit_message:
Support unaddressed port

Remove the restraint of port-without-IP/net-without-subnet when VM creating.
It's part of the neutron blueprint vm-without-l3-address.

Depends-On: I5cd1fdfa13a7e57258be7251768eaa8ba64d486e
Close-Bug: #1039665
Implements: blueprint vm-boot-with-unaddressed-port

Change-Id: I419267ea4837e73ee05f3f468e121d070379b20f

commit_message:
Don't return 300 for random urls

The osversions controller had this interesting idea that it would
return 300 multiple select if people attempted to get top level urls
without the version number in them. While this is ok in theory, it
doesn't validate that any of these urls actually exist.

As the resource structure from v2 and v2.1 on microversions evolves,
this is really not a concept that can be supported, and is unlikely to
be something that people are actually using (given that the result
links are fiction).

This removes this facility entirely.

Change-Id: Idd9b8877f2e31a75a204897c4e2be4838500a68b
Closes-Bug: #1567621

commit_message:
WIP: Raise VirtNotImplemented for ComputeDriver methods

Versioned objects, among other things, can raise NotImplementedError
which can be masked by code that's expecting and handling
NotImplementedError, like the compute manager and test_virt_drivers tests.

We should distinguish unsupported features in the virt driver from
actual lower-level failures so those don't get masked.

This adds a new type of exception for features that aren't implemented
in a virt driver. A few redundancies are removed from the hyper-v,
vmware and xenapi drivers since the base ComputeDriver class will
yield the same result.

Modify the FakeImage service so that created images always have
required attributes, which would be true if we were actually talking
to glance.

Ensure that os-consoles work as expected when VirtNotImplemented is
now raised.

TODO: we need to cover the VirtNotImplemented testing on the API side
before this can be merged. There is the start of a functional test to
do this, but it has to expand over more operations for this to be
ready.

Co-Authored-By: Sean Dague <sean@dague.net>

Change-Id: If73881270443335b991324ae6b61b1318d60f42d
Related-Bug: #1551925

commit_message:
[WIP] Make API error format conform to API-WG schema

Just a skeleton for implementing this feature is to help
reviewers understand it easily.

In the patch, only the following 4 aspects are involved.
1. Introduce BaseExceptionMeta into nova
2. Introduce a wrapper into nova
3. Enhance wsgi interface
4. Add wrapper for some APIs (e.g. detail())

APIImpact
DocImpact

Change-Id: Ibc430660daa42c5c56fc37ef2bf1777952927a1e
Co-Authored-By: caosf <caosf.fnst@cn.fujitsu.com>
Depends-On: Iad0750c7294b4e5518ba55972ae519c6fcc6532b
Implements: blueprint error-codes-support

Add PciDeviceList.save_batch()

This reduces us to a single RPC call to save N pci devices, from
N calls currently.

[{'number': 59, 'created': '2015-09-10 06:37:30.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/objects/test_instance_group.py', 'nova/objects/instance_group.py'], 'message': 'resize-revert can break anti-affinity policy

In order to resolve this problem, we can add the source compute node
into the anti-affinity servergroup when the instance has set the dest
compute node as its host. That is to say, when we setup the server group
in booting instance logic, the source and destination hosts of the
resizing/migrating instance should been add into server group hosts in
order to impact on the schedule of other instance with same server group.

Co-Authored-By: Kevin_Zheng <zhengzhenyu@huawei.com>

Change-Id: I4c9877dbc41429ec24c04fff1558d33decc17842
Closes-Bug: #1425859

commit_message:
resize-revert can break anti-affinity policy

In order to resolve this problem, we can add the source compute node
into the anti-affinity servergroup when the instance has set the dest
compute node as its host. That is to say, when we setup the server group
in booting instance logic, the source and destination hosts of the
resizing/migrating instance should been add into server group hosts in
order to impact on the schedule of other instance with same server group.

Co-Authored-By: Kevin_Zheng <zhengzhenyu@huawei.com>

Change-Id: I4c9877dbc41429ec24c04fff1558d33decc17842
Closes-Bug: #1425859

commit_message:
Add members in InstanceGroup object members field

In InstanceGroup object, add_members method doesn't add members
into object members field, which causes
objects.Quotas.count(server_group_members) won't increase, and
instance group quota check invalid.

Change-Id: I714c4d69815284a596cf80a23ca7b04d4e33b9c1
Closes-bug: #1538169

Change-Id: I72883d63c2ff7273bb2e3a0a83d3418f112841d8

commit_message:
config: consolidate console options within `console` group

Console options currently reside in DEFAULT group. Many of those have
generic names (e.g. `daemon` or `record`) and may confuse people.
Move these into a separate group to denote the fact, that they are
used solely in console proxies. Also move novnc options there, as
those are actually common options for different console proxies, not
only novnc.

Options with prefix 'console_' are renamed to avoid tautology with the
config group name.

`cert` and `key` options are renamed to make naming consistent with
the remaining SSL option `ssl_only`.

Closes-Bug: #1494207

Change-Id: I72883d63c2ff7273bb2e3a0a83d3418f112841d8

Remove the duplicated code in `nova.scheduler.claims` by refactoring
`nova.compute.claims`. The shared logics are abstracted to a new base
class `nova.compute.claims.ClaimBase`.

This refactoring only removes duplication, it doesn't change any logic
in scheduler nor compute service. So all existing tests can be passed
without change because there should be no regressions. And there are
also no new tests introduced because no features are added.

Change-Id: I753dc5a54c1ec17c6e7dd76ef270c5d485b74ca3
Implements: blueprint host-state-level-locking
"}]
commit_message:
Refactor claim code to eliminate duplication

Remove the duplicated code in `nova.scheduler.claims` by refactoring
`nova.compute.claims`. The shared logics are abstracted to a new base
class `nova.compute.claims.ClaimBase`.

This refactoring only removes duplication, it doesn't change any logic
in scheduler nor compute service. So all existing tests can be passed
without change because there should be no regressions. And there are
also no new tests introduced because no features are added.

Change-Id: I753dc5a54c1ec17c6e7dd76ef270c5d485b74ca3
Implements: blueprint host-state-level-locking

commit_message:
libvirt, vhostuser: Add support for OpenContrail vRouter

OpenContrail vRouter can be used as a userspace DPDK based virtual switch
application that uses QEMU's vhost-user interface types. This requires adding
support for vRouter in {plug, unplug}_vhostuser() methods similarly as it is
done for OVS.

Change-Id: I8e8f76db8717c7621024b8947281a6f785f572dd
Implements: blueprint libvirt-vhostuser-vrouter-vif
Signed-off-by: Michal Dubiel <md@semihalf.com>

subject: Principle sends invalid config to hacluster
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-26 18:11:03.000000000', 'files': ['common.py'], 'message': 'Principle sends invalid config to hacluster

When requesting hacluster manage an init service the principle
sends options to hacluster but is currently erroneously sending
the word 'param' as well. eg

The pinciple is setting:
''res_designate_haproxy'': ''  params op monitor interval="5s"''

When it should be:
''res_designate_haproxy'': ''op monitor interval="5s"''

Including the word 'params' evenutally causes hacluster to fail with:
ERROR: syntax in primitive: params op monitor interval=5s

Change-Id: Id35bb22692914dc3f94465d8ae7d62971a238d4e
'}]
commit_message:
Principle sends invalid config to hacluster

When requesting hacluster manage an init service the principle
sends options to hacluster but is currently erroneously sending
the word 'param' as well. eg

The pinciple is setting:
''res_designate_haproxy'': ''  params op monitor interval="5s"''

When it should be:
''res_designate_haproxy'': ''op monitor interval="5s"''

Including the word 'params' evenutally causes hacluster to fail with:
ERROR: syntax in primitive: params op monitor interval=5s

Change-Id: Id35bb22692914dc3f94465d8ae7d62971a238d4e

Currently the Nova provides single VM snapshot API (createImage), which
will take a consistency snapshot of a VM and regarding volumes, and will
quiesce unquiesce VM automatily with guest agent support.This method is good
for single VM consistency snapshot, but no way to make consistency
snapshot for an application which consists of multiple VMs.

Provide quiesce unquiesce API from Nova, to make consistency snapshot
of an application, which consists of a  group of VMs, for disaster
recovery purpose from another site.

Quiesce / unquiesce API will allo making snapshot of a group of
VMs in a transaction way, for example, quiesce VM1, quiesce VM2, quiesce VM3,
snapshot VM1's volumes, snapshot VM2's volumes, snapshot VM3's volumes,
unquiesce VM3, unquiesce VM2, unquiesce VM1. For some telecom application,
the order is important for a group of VMs with strong relationship.

"}]
commit_message:
Expose quiesce/unquiesce API

Currently the Nova provides single VM snapshot API (createImage), which
will take a consistency snapshot of a VM and regarding volumes, and will
quiesce unquiesce VM automatily with guest agent support.This method is good
for single VM consistency snapshot, but no way to make consistency
snapshot for an application which consists of multiple VMs.

Provide quiesce unquiesce API from Nova, to make consistency snapshot
of an application, which consists of a  group of VMs, for disaster
recovery purpose from another site.

Quiesce / unquiesce API will allo making snapshot of a group of
VMs in a transaction way, for example, quiesce VM1, quiesce VM2, quiesce VM3,
snapshot VM1's volumes, snapshot VM2's volumes, snapshot VM3's volumes,
unquiesce VM3, unquiesce VM2, unquiesce VM1. For some telecom application,
the order is important for a group of VMs with strong relationship.

This patch exposes the quiesce and unquiesce API

Co-Authored-By: Chaoyi Huang <joehuang@huawei.com>
Co-Authored-By: Rui Chen <chenrui.momo@gmail.com>

APIImpact: Expose quiesce unquiesce API
DocImpact: Expose quiesce unquiesce API

Change-Id: I9ad01d0ef58b9f21ad2909b74fcdf00338df6f2c
Implements: blueprint expose-quiesce-unquiesce-api

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-04-21 02:56:41.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/volume/test_cinder.py', 'nova/volume/cinder.py'], 'message': "fix admin context scenarios for cinderclient

When cinderclient got an admin context without token passed in,
the client don't really have the ability to communicate with cinder
service. This is because there is no auth_token and service_catalog
info in this admin context. Nova maintains some daemon threads
doing administrative jobs like reclaiming soft-deleted instances
which exactly have one such admin context. In such case, nova was
unable to detach the volumes attached to soft-deleted instances.

This patch allow admin credentials to be specified in cinder section
of nova.conf. When case above happened, nova will load one real
admin auth plugin from cinder section and use it to communicate
with cinder. The admin user used here is better to be cinder with
admin roles.

The auth plugin once loaded is reusable.

DocImpact: add keystone auth options to cinder section. They are:
auth_type, auth_section, auth_url, domain_id, domain_name,
project_id, project_name, project_domain_id, project_domain_name,
trust_id, user_id, username, user_domain_id, user_domain_name,
password. If auth_section is set, all options except auth_type and
auth_section should be set in the section specified by auth_section.

Closes-Bug: 1560300
Related-Bug: 1408865
Related-Bug: 1346866

Change-Id: I775b65cc4664bf0c5700434747b622a182db8131
Signed-off-by: apporc <appleorchard2000@gmail.com>
"}]
commit_message:
fix admin context scenarios for cinderclient

When cinderclient got an admin context without token passed in,
the client don't really have the ability to communicate with cinder
service. This is because there is no auth_token and service_catalog
info in this admin context. Nova maintains some daemon threads
doing administrative jobs like reclaiming soft-deleted instances
which exactly have one such admin context. In such case, nova was
unable to detach the volumes attached to soft-deleted instances.

This patch allow admin credentials to be specified in cinder section
of nova.conf. When case above happened, nova will load one real
admin auth plugin from cinder section and use it to communicate
with cinder. The admin user used here is better to be cinder with
admin roles.

The auth plugin once loaded is reusable.

DocImpact: add keystone auth options to cinder section. They are:
auth_type, auth_section, auth_url, domain_id, domain_name,
project_id, project_name, project_domain_id, project_domain_name,
trust_id, user_id, username, user_domain_id, user_domain_name,
password. If auth_section is set, all options except auth_type and
auth_section should be set in the section specified by auth_section.

Closes-Bug: 1560300
Related-Bug: 1408865
Related-Bug: 1346866

Change-Id: I775b65cc4664bf0c5700434747b622a182db8131
Signed-off-by: apporc <appleorchard2000@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Merge os-user-data extension into servers

The extension already deprecated in nova api, and the current extension
point didn't support Microversion, this isn't a way for extension point
to process differently with different Microversion. So this patch just
merge the os-user-data extension into servers directly to get rid of
the useless extension and extension point.

APIImpact
Partial implement blueprint userdata-modification

Change-Id: I5c761623cfe36b3eb64bcede21494fff27b6b926

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-07-04 13:34:15.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/devref/zfs_on_linux_driver.rst', 'manila/share/drivers/zfsonlinux/utils.py', 'manila/tests/share/drivers/zfsonlinux/test_driver.py', 'releasenotes/notes/manage-share-in-zfsonlinux-driver-e80921081206f75b.yaml', 'contrib/ci/post_test_hook.sh', 'manila/share/drivers/zfsonlinux/driver.py', 'manila/tests/share/drivers/zfsonlinux/test_utils.py', 'doc/source/devref/share_back_ends_feature_support_mapping.rst'], 'message': '[ZFSonLinux] Add 'manage share' feature support

Implement 'manage share' feature in ZFSonLinux share driver.

Prerequisites:
- share being managed should exist.
- share being managed should not be part of any replication relations.
- share being managed should not have redefined mountpoint.

Details:
- share being managed will be renamed by share driver based on taken ID.
- share being managed will get "quota" attribute set based on provided
  value in API (--driver_options size=5) or it will set quota
  to nearest bigger rounded integer of already
  used space (2,4 -> 3, 3.6 -> 4).

Implements blueprint zfsonlinux-manage-share
DocImpact

Change-Id: I03eab5e02835fe660dde0020601c02c0136bddeb
'}]
commit_message:
[ZFSonLinux] Add 'manage share' feature support

Implement 'manage share' feature in ZFSonLinux share driver.

Prerequisites:
- share being managed should exist.
- share being managed should not be part of any replication relations.
- share being managed should not have redefined mountpoint.

Details:
- share being managed will be renamed by share driver based on taken ID.
- share being managed will get "quota" attribute set based on provided
  value in API (--driver_options size=5) or it will set quota
  to nearest bigger rounded integer of already
  used space (2,4 -> 3, 3.6 -> 4).

Implements blueprint zfsonlinux-manage-share
DocImpact

Change-Id: I03eab5e02835fe660dde0020601c02c0136bddeb

get_disk_backing_file in fake_libvirt_utils did not accept the
basename argument of the method it fakes, and obviously also did not
honour its function.

commit_message:
Only ports on routed networks are deferred

A port has deferred IP allocation only if it is on a routed network.
Otherwise, it is just a port without any IP addresses.

The unit tests were testing for deferred IP allocation even in
situations where the network was not routed, so this patch fixes them
up.

Change-Id: Ieeab03c31b8f45d63b5044d85ded704d2fe027a9
Partially-Implements: blueprint routed-networks

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-07-26 03:58:40.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/api/rpc/handlers/dhcp_rpc.py', 'neutron/services/segments/db.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/api/rpc/handlers/test_dhcp_rpc.py'], 'message': "Filter out subnets on different segments for dhcp

The dhcp agent will request network information from neutron-server.
neutron-server will give the dhcp agent the entire network tree back
to the agent including subnets.  If that agent is on a host that
is mapped to a segment, subnets that do not belong to that
segment are also returned and the dhcp agent will attempt to create
or update the dhcp port based on those subnets.  These requests
will fail because the ipam logic forbids it for multiple segments.

This patch strips out those subnets that do not belong to the host's
segment.  If the segments plugin is not enabled or the network is not
a routed network then the neutron-server will return back to the agent
what it normally would without routed networks.

Change-Id: I379b56f510853c60bb52c2d710117fecfb9aca2e
Partially-Implements: blueprint routed-networks
"}]
commit_message:
Filter out subnets on different segments for dhcp

The dhcp agent will request network information from neutron-server.
neutron-server will give the dhcp agent the entire network tree back
to the agent including subnets.  If that agent is on a host that
is mapped to a segment, subnets that do not belong to that
segment are also returned and the dhcp agent will attempt to create
or update the dhcp port based on those subnets.  These requests
will fail because the ipam logic forbids it for multiple segments.

This patch strips out those subnets that do not belong to the host's
segment.  If the segments plugin is not enabled or the network is not
a routed network then the neutron-server will return back to the agent
what it normally would without routed networks.

Change-Id: I379b56f510853c60bb52c2d710117fecfb9aca2e
Partially-Implements: blueprint routed-networks

This commit cleans up the image file options and workflow for

commit switches to having a single option to specify the location of

commit_message:
Cleanup image file options in scenario tests

This commit cleans up the image file options and workflow for
specifying image files in the scenario tests. Instead of having
multiple options and a fallback to amazon style 3 part images this
commit switches to having a single option to specify the location of
an image file to upload and will raise an exception if it's not found.

Change-Id: Ib1ddfadb30fb8c8f663e3febcae706fe30b1f573
Closes-Bug: #1393881

subject: Only update port ACLs if necessary
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-07-22 19:34:21.000000000', 'files': ['networking_ovn/tests/unit/ml2/test_mech_driver.py', 'networking_ovn/ml2/mech_driver.py', 'networking_ovn/ovsdb/commands.py'], 'message': "Only update port ACLs if necessary

Port ACLs are always being deleted and added on a port update
even if the update doesn't impact ACLs (e.g. update port name).
This patch set will only update port ACLs when the port's
fixed IPs or security groups have changed. In addition, the
update will compare the old and new ACLs to compress the OVN
transaction down to the ACL changes.

When an instance is launched, there will be 3 port updates for
host binding, vif binding and status update. These updates do
not change the port ACLs, yet resulted in 51 unnecessary ACL
transactions (assuming the use of the default security group).

Basic performance testing with this change improved port update
without ACL changes by approximately 12%.

Change-Id: I91bed00fb3f7c42efbc2d5156095b13d9348b6f5
Closes-Bug: #1605274
"}]
commit_message:
Only update port ACLs if necessary

Port ACLs are always being deleted and added on a port update
even if the update doesn't impact ACLs (e.g. update port name).
This patch set will only update port ACLs when the port's
fixed IPs or security groups have changed. In addition, the
update will compare the old and new ACLs to compress the OVN
transaction down to the ACL changes.

When an instance is launched, there will be 3 port updates for
host binding, vif binding and status update. These updates do
not change the port ACLs, yet resulted in 51 unnecessary ACL
transactions (assuming the use of the default security group).

Basic performance testing with this change improved port update
without ACL changes by approximately 12%.

Change-Id: I91bed00fb3f7c42efbc2d5156095b13d9348b6f5

commit_message:
Handle new-format facets response

As part of
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/searchlight/+spec/count-endpoint the
API facets endpoint is changing. This patch adds support for both
formats during the transition period by converting old-format responses
to the new one ({resource_type: []} -> {resource_type: {facets: []}}

Change-Id: Ibe22a97bda0d7990ab19ef65fd5d63d84e1465f5
Partially-implements: blueprint count-endpoint

subject: Support new facet response format
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-22 20:45:47.000000000', 'files': ['searchlightclient/tests/unit/osc/v1/fakes.py', 'searchlightclient/v1/facets.py', 'searchlightclient/osc/v1/facet.py', 'searchlightclient/tests/unit/osc/v1/test_facet.py'], 'message': "Support new facet response format

The facet response format is changing as part of
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/searchlight/+spec/count-endpoint such
that the value for each resource type becomes a dictionary (instead of a
list) with keys 'facets' and 'doc_count'. This patch allows
python-searchlightclient to parse either response in preparation for the
change.

Change-Id: Iddd3ad4bfe277c513a304ff03eccffa8ba928973
Partially-implements: blueprint count-endpoint
"}]
commit_message:
Support new facet response format

The facet response format is changing as part of
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/searchlight/+spec/count-endpoint such
that the value for each resource type becomes a dictionary (instead of a
list) with keys 'facets' and 'doc_count'. This patch allows
python-searchlightclient to parse either response in preparation for the
change.

Change-Id: Iddd3ad4bfe277c513a304ff03eccffa8ba928973
Partially-implements: blueprint count-endpoint

subject: Added quotes to example echo in swift-temp-url
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-07-26 13:48:26.000000000', 'files': ['bin/swift-temp-url', 'doc/source/api/temporary_url_middleware.rst'], 'message': 'Added quotes to example echo in swift-temp-url

If the curl command is used exactly as in the help, the ampersand
in the signature is interpreted as an operator and the curl
command breaks. I am aware of developers who have wasted a lot of
time because of this.

Change-Id: I6468c9a098b56db8242a2cf2c23b7a4857bd8574
'}]
commit_message:
Added quotes to example echo in swift-temp-url

If the curl command is used exactly as in the help, the ampersand
in the signature is interpreted as an operator and the curl
command breaks. I am aware of developers who have wasted a lot of
time because of this.

Change-Id: I6468c9a098b56db8242a2cf2c23b7a4857bd8574

This patch set aims to move all the code related to DNS integration

db_base_plugin_v2 and the dns exteions module talks with core plugin

By properly implementing the generation of the dns_assignment attribute
for ports in the DNS ML2 extension module, this patchset also fixes
https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1579977

Change-Id: I63afb1a1bfeeb14eefb54681dc64959144deeb25
Closes-Bug: #1579601
Closes-Bug: #1579977

commit_message:
Refactor DNS integration out of DB core plugin

This patch set aims to move all the code related to DNS integration
from the DB core plugin to the DNS ML2 extension module.

By doing this, this patchset removes the dns related code in
db_base_plugin_v2 and the dns exteions module talks with core plugin
only through the method extension_manager and apply_dict_extend_functions

By properly implementing the generation of the dns_assignment attribute
for ports in the DNS ML2 extension module, this patchset also fixes
https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1579977

Change-Id: I63afb1a1bfeeb14eefb54681dc64959144deeb25
Closes-Bug: #1579601
Closes-Bug: #1579977

commit_message:
Rename DB columns: tenant -> project

All occurences of ``tenant_id`` across the neutron database are
being renamed to ``project_id``.

This networking-midonet change accompanies the neutron change:
I87a8ef342ccea004731ba0192b23a8e79bc382dc

Partially-Implements: blueprint keystone-v3

Change-Id: Ia59629fd953750c9f7d495e74c7ca6cfbf3ca077

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-07-26 14:44:05.000000000', 'files': ['octane/magic_consts.py', 'octane/commands/upgrade_env.py', 'octane/util/env.py'], 'message': 'Copy Fuel's keys in upgrade-env command

  Those keys are generated on the first "deploy_changes" for
  an environtment.

  It's ok to regenerate them in the majority cases,
  but, for example, in case of TLS + self-signed certificate
  it would be a problem. MongoDB replication also depends on
  those keys.

Change-Id: I6e5e65feff2b662336028ca5114f7245147d664f
Closes-Bug: 1595499
'}]
commit_message:
Copy Fuel's keys in upgrade-env command

  Those keys are generated on the first "deploy_changes" for
  an environtment.

  It's ok to regenerate them in the majority cases,
  but, for example, in case of TLS + self-signed certificate
  it would be a problem. MongoDB replication also depends on
  those keys.

Change-Id: I6e5e65feff2b662336028ca5114f7245147d664f
Closes-Bug: 1595499

- Manage share: ask Manila to take control of an existing ZFSSA share
not managed by Manila driver. Current share size will be rounded up
to the nearest whole GB value.
- Unmanage share: ask Manila to release control of a ZFSSA share
managed by the driver.

Change-Id: I0d4a46211dfd15cb7a261eddfa8c14be26adcfc3
Implements: blueprint oracle-zfssa-share-manage
'}]
commit_message:
Add share manage/unmanage of Oracle ZFSSA driver

- Manage share: ask Manila to take control of an existing ZFSSA share
not managed by Manila driver. Current share size will be rounded up
to the nearest whole GB value.
- Unmanage share: ask Manila to release control of a ZFSSA share
managed by the driver.

Change-Id: I0d4a46211dfd15cb7a261eddfa8c14be26adcfc3
Implements: blueprint oracle-zfssa-share-manage

commit_message:
Add trove tempest plugin

This commit takes the trove tests which previously lived in tempest
and creates an in-tree tempest plugin out of them. The contents of
the plugin are taken with tempest checkout out at commit:
eda607cb1c89762a54290c4525d81c1b192c421f with modifications made for
things to live in the trove repo.

Change-Id: Ibad5502cdca0e34cca4b5bc8a7106611f7393cf2

The pending release of oslo.context (2.6.0) introduces a new attribute
to the to_dict() method that will break tests that do a exact dictionary
comparison.  This patch creates a smarter forward compatible approach
to enable existing tests to function as designed and support new
attributes without failure.

Change-Id: I4829ad11d84bf7bd5ea3b87a46c799aa16d183cf
Closes-Bug: 1603979
'}]
commit_message:
Prepare context tests for new to_dict() attributes

The pending release of oslo.context (2.6.0) introduces a new attribute
to the to_dict() method that will break tests that do a exact dictionary
comparison.  This patch creates a smarter forward compatible approach
to enable existing tests to function as designed and support new
attributes without failure.

Change-Id: I4829ad11d84bf7bd5ea3b87a46c799aa16d183cf
Closes-Bug: 1603979

commit_message:
Replace OpenStack LLC w/ OpenStack Foundation

Some files use trademark OpenStack LLC in header, which
should be changed to OpenStack Foundation according to
openstack trademark policy.
http://www.openstack.org/brand/openstack-trademark-policy/

Change-Id: I3b4665c023acc6d53dcf17417b4ce625ed3d096b
Related-Bug: #1214176

subject: Tighten the trusty job filter for OpenStack-Ansible
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-26 17:10:12.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "Tighten the trusty job filter for OpenStack-Ansible

Only the functional jobs should run, not the docs jobs too. As the

Change-Id: I71d247d0253bd8f42ae2984a9a5c1b91ceb01a79
"}]
commit_message:
Tighten the trusty job filter for OpenStack-Ansible

Only the functional jobs should run, not the docs jobs too. As the
functional jobs could be 'func' or any other name, a negative match
is used on the docs job name instead.

Change-Id: I71d247d0253bd8f42ae2984a9a5c1b91ceb01a79

revisions:

Replace dict.iteritems() with dict.items(). The Python 3 dict

TrivialFix.

Change-Id: I2137e72554fd16d2c70e50306e4f57d27e35bcd3

commit_message:
Python 3: dict.iteritems()

Replace dict.iteritems() with dict.items(). The Python 3 dict
type has no iteritems() method, the old iteritems() method was
renamed to items().

TrivialFix.

Change-Id: I2137e72554fd16d2c70e50306e4f57d27e35bcd3

subject: Configure memcached using new settings in [cache] section
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-22 15:50:43.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/profile/base/nova.pp'], 'message': 'Configure memcached using new settings in [cache] section

Some components like the vnc console make use of a shared cache to share
auth tokens between the controllers.  This makes a shared cache a kind of
requirement for these features to correctly work.  The configuration of
memcached servers has changed from the deprecated memcached_servers setting
in [DEFAULT] to several settings in the [cache] section.  This patch sets
these settings in order to make sure a shared cache is used.

Change-Id: I8add7bc7870ede7bbdd0df6a5bc5199e32a5ab33
'}]
commit_message:
Configure memcached using new settings in [cache] section

Some components like the vnc console make use of a shared cache to share
auth tokens between the controllers.  This makes a shared cache a kind of
requirement for these features to correctly work.  The configuration of
memcached servers has changed from the deprecated memcached_servers setting
in [DEFAULT] to several settings in the [cache] section.  This patch sets
these settings in order to make sure a shared cache is used.

Change-Id: I8add7bc7870ede7bbdd0df6a5bc5199e32a5ab33

subject: Fix races in advertise_address unit tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-26 14:25:54.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_python_agent/tests/unit/test_agent.py'], 'message': "Fix races in advertise_address unit tests

This was testing that _check_for_iscsi was called, which is part of
evaluate_hardware_support for the in-tree hardware manager.
evaluate_hardware_support is called at hardware manager instantiation,
which can happen when dispatch_to_managers is called. The hardware
manager instances are cached, so calling dispatch_to_managers won't
always invoke _check_for_iscsi. As such, these tests were intermittently
failing.

Mock _check_for_iscsi at the class level for these tests (since it's
unrelated), and don't check that it was called.

Change-Id: Iefca50c4c231c5eafd199bf8da6649bc3008a8fa
"}]
commit_message:
Fix races in advertise_address unit tests

This was testing that _check_for_iscsi was called, which is part of
evaluate_hardware_support for the in-tree hardware manager.
evaluate_hardware_support is called at hardware manager instantiation,
which can happen when dispatch_to_managers is called. The hardware
manager instances are cached, so calling dispatch_to_managers won't
always invoke _check_for_iscsi. As such, these tests were intermittently
failing.

Mock _check_for_iscsi at the class level for these tests (since it's
unrelated), and don't check that it was called.

Change-Id: Iefca50c4c231c5eafd199bf8da6649bc3008a8fa

commit_message:
Remove Cinder leftovers from Create Snapshot View

Share state cannot be "in-use", so the whole if statement
is unused. This patch removes it and makes a corresponding
cleanup in html template and unit test.

Change-Id: I5030ed7751e561db7d1b7ab1255d6fa8daf387f9

The "host" field in driver private data related db and api is not

commit_message:
Fixing bug in debug_logger

Compressing kwargs is having unneeded side effect of corrupting
request header.

Change-Id: I799d3db864836c2bc2d64d99c91b6cf7e302e151

subject: Remove sahara and cinder packaged symlinks in postci
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-26 10:13:02.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/common_functions.sh'], 'message': "Remove sahara and cinder packaged symlinks in postci

If a job fails before the overcloud deployment starts, the ansible task
run by infra to collect logs will fail because of dangling symlinks on
the subnodes in the /etc/cinder and /etc/sahara directories.

This change just remove the symlinks on each subnodo so that the rsync

Closes-Bug: #1606368

commit_message:
Remove sahara and cinder packaged symlinks in postci

If a job fails before the overcloud deployment starts, the ansible task
run by infra to collect logs will fail because of dangling symlinks on
the subnodes in the /etc/cinder and /etc/sahara directories.

This change just remove the symlinks on each subnodo so that the rsync
command to collect the logs won't fail.

Change-Id: If0a151abdeaa1e607d672175f8bcb170027b9ac6
Closes-Bug: #1606368

commit_message:
Make sure --bypass-url honored if specified

Currently SessionClient ignored --bypass-url which is only used with
HTTPClient. This change force to use HTTPClient if bypass-url specified.

Change-Id: I03d1eec8cfda81efce409399b8d6ca91b779840b
Closes-Bug: #1467577

subject: etcd: properly block when using 'wait'
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-07-20 13:52:35.000000000', 'files': ['tooz/drivers/etcd.py', 'tooz/tests/test_etcd.py', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "etcd: properly block when using 'wait'

When using the wait functionality, one must use the last index increased
by one, as the wait returns once that index has been used. Using the
index that is already been returned by the etcd instance will cause
'wait' to return immediately, producing a busy-wait loop while spamming
the server with the same requests over and over.

Closes-Bug: #1603002
Change-Id: I4f3bee0a52dcf2eb69b96b53a9f777a5e2a7efb1
"}]
commit_message:
etcd: properly block when using 'wait'

When using the wait functionality, one must use the last index increased
by one, as the wait returns once that index has been used. Using the
index that is already been returned by the etcd instance will cause
'wait' to return immediately, producing a busy-wait loop while spamming
the server with the same requests over and over.

Closes-Bug: #1603002
Change-Id: I4f3bee0a52dcf2eb69b96b53a9f777a5e2a7efb1

commit_message:
Add check to limit maximum value of age_in_days

If you pass age_in_days value greater than unix epoch
then it raises OverflowError. Added check to ensure
age_in_days is within unix epoch time to fix this problem.

Removed the redundant check for age_in_days value from
cinder.db.sqlalchemy.api module which is already checked
at cinder.cmd.manage module.

Closes-Bug: #1543937
Change-Id: Ib418627fb8527a1275c2656d1451f1e1dfeb72ef

subject: Ensure that doc linting is included in the linters test
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-25 13:06:42.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Ensure that doc linting is included in the linters test

The 'docs' tox target executes the doc8 lint test which may result in
failures when testing documentation builds, but OpenStack-CI does not
execute that tox target.

In order to ensure that we catch all standard documentation syntax
errors and prevent them from merging, this patch includes the docs
target in the 'linters' chain of tests.

Fixes for any failures which result from executing this test are also
included in the patch.

Change-Id: I336dae4702abb0a671b940bdc50afeb21a118d6f
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure that doc linting is included in the linters test

The 'docs' tox target executes the doc8 lint test which may result in
failures when testing documentation builds, but OpenStack-CI does not
execute that tox target.

In order to ensure that we catch all standard documentation syntax
errors and prevent them from merging, this patch includes the docs
target in the 'linters' chain of tests.

Fixes for any failures which result from executing this test are also
included in the patch.

Change-Id: I336dae4702abb0a671b940bdc50afeb21a118d6f

subject: Disable V-38660 in gate
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-26 16:48:28.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Disable V-38660 in gate

The Xenial image in the CI gate has non-SNMPv3 configurations
and it causes the security role to halt the playbook. This patch
skips the task until we can figure out a better fix.

Change-Id: I7b18b392c9e24e638c5e70e594f065f50a19b6b9
'}]
commit_message:
Disable V-38660 in gate

The Xenial image in the CI gate has non-SNMPv3 configurations
and it causes the security role to halt the playbook. This patch
skips the task until we can figure out a better fix.

Change-Id: I7b18b392c9e24e638c5e70e594f065f50a19b6b9

errors and prevent them from merging, this patch includes the docs
target in the 'linters' chain of tests.

included in the patch.

revisions:
[{'number': 29, 'created': '2016-07-19 11:21:50.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/tests/test_service_clients.py', 'tempest/service_clients.py'], 'message': 'Introduce the ClientsFactory

Define a new class ClientsFactory, which provides lazy loading
an simple instantiation of clients by using partial to set
defaults for all client parameters.

This class will be used in upcoming patches to implement an
interface that allows plugins to register their own service
clients in the ServiceClients interface.

It will also be used to implement lazy loading of clients for
tempest own clients.

Partially-implements: bp client-manager-refactor

Change-Id: If2295d56a8e52ffce28d6a0f15517bc325aab010
'}]
commit_message:
Introduce the ClientsFactory

Define a new class ClientsFactory, which provides lazy loading
an simple instantiation of clients by using partial to set
defaults for all client parameters.

This class will be used in upcoming patches to implement an
interface that allows plugins to register their own service
clients in the ServiceClients interface.

It will also be used to implement lazy loading of clients for
tempest own clients.

Partially-implements: bp client-manager-refactor

Change-Id: If2295d56a8e52ffce28d6a0f15517bc325aab010

subject: Remove aliases of rpc backend for messaging
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-25 11:35:11.000000000', 'files': ['smaug/rpc.py'], 'message': 'Remove aliases of rpc backend for messaging

oslo.messaging has deprecated usage of transport aliases.
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/180434/
we should remove aliases of rpc backend for messaging.

Change-Id: If3b604bebdce774dc2580da6577efd726e09dce5
Closes-Bug: #1606125
'}]
commit_message:
Remove aliases of rpc backend for messaging

oslo.messaging has deprecated usage of transport aliases.
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/180434/
we should remove aliases of rpc backend for messaging.

Change-Id: If3b604bebdce774dc2580da6577efd726e09dce5
Closes-Bug: #1606125

commit_message:
Ensure that doc linting is included in the linters test

The 'docs' tox target executes the doc8 lint test which may result in
failures when testing documentation builds, but OpenStack-CI does not
execute that tox target.

In order to ensure that we catch all standard documentation syntax
errors and prevent them from merging, this patch includes the docs
target in the 'linters' chain of tests.

Fixes for any failures which result from executing this test are also
included in the patch.

Change-Id: I845683e494b5be7d7e514c2ee12a0f9c13ce0713

commit_message:
different-format-for-ipv4-and-ipv6

This change will allow users to define seperate
formats for ipv4 and ipv6 addresses.
this requires formatv4 and formatv6 to de defined in
designate.conf instead of format.

format has been marked depricated

Change-Id: Ief685ba6a00da5100013f4ab71768c661f37ee13
Implements: blueprint different-format-for-ipv4-and-ipv6

This patch updates all the roles to the latest available stable
SHA's, copies the release notes from the updated roles into the
integrated repo, updates all the OpenStack Service SHA's, and
updates the appropriate python requirements pins.

It also includes the following:

- The requirements.txt file has been updated to ensure that it
  has the same requirements as those in OpenStack global-requirements
  for stable/mitaka.

- The sources-branch-updater script will only update SHA's/tags
  for OpenStack roles. This is primarily for usage in stable
  branches where external roles must not be changed after release.

- The script will no longer update the *requirements.txt files.
  These files are managed by the OpenStack Global Requirements
  management process.

- The pins for pip, setuptools and wheels are now set in the
  global-requirement-pins.txt file in order to ensure that it
  takes precedence in the repo build process above all other
  requirements.

- The order of the requirements.txt file has been changed to ensure
  that pip, setuptools and wheels is installed first whenever the
  requirements.txt file is used.

- The pin comment has been removed from the requirements.txt file
  as it no longer applies..

Change-Id: I2d792947b2502eadff9adc08c5b21dca33f37856
Depends-On: I9972158427cf06844a1af68f43479428def0f3b7
Depends-On: I36d2044965c8a0809a417083c3f24c406b5a36c9
Depends-On: I53864a34f3ba56a84ed658fa3952aba3c509e0b1
"}]
commit_message:
Update all SHAs for 13.3.0

This patch updates all the roles to the latest available stable
SHA's, copies the release notes from the updated roles into the
integrated repo, updates all the OpenStack Service SHA's, and
updates the appropriate python requirements pins.

It also includes the following:

- The requirements.txt file has been updated to ensure that it
  has the same requirements as those in OpenStack global-requirements
  for stable/mitaka.

- The sources-branch-updater script will only update SHA's/tags
  for OpenStack roles. This is primarily for usage in stable
  branches where external roles must not be changed after release.

- The script will no longer update the *requirements.txt files.
  These files are managed by the OpenStack Global Requirements
  management process.

- The pins for pip, setuptools and wheels are now set in the
  global-requirement-pins.txt file in order to ensure that it
  takes precedence in the repo build process above all other
  requirements.

- The order of the requirements.txt file has been changed to ensure
  that pip, setuptools and wheels is installed first whenever the
  requirements.txt file is used.

- The pin comment has been removed from the requirements.txt file
  as it no longer applies..

Change-Id: I2d792947b2502eadff9adc08c5b21dca33f37856
Depends-On: I9972158427cf06844a1af68f43479428def0f3b7
Depends-On: I36d2044965c8a0809a417083c3f24c406b5a36c9
Depends-On: I53864a34f3ba56a84ed658fa3952aba3c509e0b1

commit_message:
Fix typo in baymodel param

A param for the coe in baymodel currently reads 'mondatory',
it should be 'mandatory'.

Closes-Bug: #1605705
Change-Id: I519a7c4cc56d5c53ecaccaed07dfad774b4c4900

commit_message:
Ensure that doc linting is included in the linters test

The 'docs' tox target executes the doc8 lint test which may result in
failures when testing documentation builds, but OpenStack-CI does not
execute that tox target.

In order to ensure that we catch all standard documentation syntax
errors and prevent them from merging, this patch includes the docs
target in the 'linters' chain of tests.

Fixes for any failures which result from executing this test are also
included in the patch.

Change-Id: I077633386eeb83f94660547baf44e0edcfb34f78

subject: Fix improperly rendered Create Snapshot modal form
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-26 13:13:19.000000000', 'files': ['manila_ui/dashboards/project/shares/snapshots/views.py'], 'message': 'Fix improperly rendered Create Snapshot modal form

Create Share Snapshot form validation works for only one time.
On the second try whatever values are used, a correct ones or not,
the form closes with "There was an error submitting the form.
Please try again." message. It appears that form_invalid method
returns broken submit url. This patch moves rendering to get_initial
method to get a proper submit url for valid and invalid forms.

Change-Id: Ic41a49570e947026ec1a03a7a6fc99a7fb320f1c
Closes-Bug: #1585244
'}]
commit_message:
Fix improperly rendered Create Snapshot modal form

Create Share Snapshot form validation works for only one time.
On the second try whatever values are used, a correct ones or not,
the form closes with "There was an error submitting the form.
Please try again." message. It appears that form_invalid method
returns broken submit url. This patch moves rendering to get_initial
method to get a proper submit url for valid and invalid forms.

Change-Id: Ic41a49570e947026ec1a03a7a6fc99a7fb320f1c
Closes-Bug: #1585244

So, we had a bug on live-migration calls where we were verifying the
RequestSpec object for getting the original request but we trusted
the InstanceGroup persisted information that could be out-of-date.
A follow-up of that change will consist in considering the group information
for the RequestSpec to be lazy-loadable so we always get fresh content, but
given the bug is pretty important, we first need to have an easy way to fix the
problem without requiring a huge change in the object that would prevent a
backport.

Change-Id: I500383d8c9af90c0984d4f8b555e93a510d1c97e

commit_message:
WIP: Update group information in live-migration conditional

So, we had a bug on live-migration calls where we were verifying the
RequestSpec object for getting the original request but we trusted
the InstanceGroup persisted information that could be out-of-date.
A follow-up of that change will consist in considering the group information
for the RequestSpec to be lazy-loadable so we always get fresh content, but
given the bug is pretty important, we first need to have an easy way to fix the
problem without requiring a huge change in the object that would prevent a
backport.

TODO: Missing UTs

Change-Id: I500383d8c9af90c0984d4f8b555e93a510d1c97e
Closes-Bug: #1400016

commit_message:
Allow for Ceph per-pool parameters

With this change pg_num, pgp_num and size can be redefined for each
pool instead of being enforced to the same set of values for all pools.

Change-Id: I0a001d2ce5666f43f4b5d56b3cd32cf17a1edae6
Closes-Bug: 1517969

subject: Remove unused code when failing to start console
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-24 14:50:34.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/drivers/modules/console_utils.py'], 'message': 'Remove unused code when failing to start console

Processutils.ProcessExecutionError is never raised when it is unable
to stop an old shellinabox process due to a fix[1][2]. Instead of the
error, ConsoleError is raised. It would be better not to ignore the
error and to fail to start a console for avoiding process leak.

This patch removes a block for the exception which is never raised.

[1]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/242319/
[2]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/244699/

Change-Id: Ia1226da652510c5655c9b8c270e6fc168efd935d
'}]
commit_message:
Remove unused code when failing to start console

Processutils.ProcessExecutionError is never raised when it is unable
to stop an old shellinabox process due to a fix[1][2]. Instead of the
error, ConsoleError is raised. It would be better not to ignore the
error and to fail to start a console for avoiding process leak.

This patch removes a block for the exception which is never raised.

[1]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/242319/
[2]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/244699/

Change-Id: Ia1226da652510c5655c9b8c270e6fc168efd935d

commit_message:
devstack: configurable ODL repositories paths

Make the OpenDaylight snapshot & release repositories paths a
configuration so those can be overridden in case you prefer using
a proxy repository for them (for fetching artfiacts more
efficiently), and the proxy has a different path for them.

Change-Id: I9d8cfa92d15fe2e975b40312193f23ad02af8cd7

subject: Bump default undercloud vCPUs to 8
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-26 13:20:28.000000000', 'files': ['roles/common/defaults/main.yml', 'config/general_config/ha.yml'], 'message': "Bump default undercloud vCPUs to 8

Three out of the four chassis' in CentOS CI have slower CPUs, but
they have more of cores. I have tested bumping the number of CPUs
on the undercloud on these slower chassis' and it made a big
difference. More so, the memory pressure on the undercloud is
actually not bad now, so there is not too much risk in hitting
issues where more CPUs causes high memory consumption.

This also increases the default in the HA configuration by the same
factor (2x).

Change-Id: I44f34827774353f9f70e7fd51c524567914059ab
"}]
commit_message:
Bump default undercloud vCPUs to 8

Three out of the four chassis' in CentOS CI have slower CPUs, but
they have more of cores. I have tested bumping the number of CPUs
on the undercloud on these slower chassis' and it made a big
difference. More so, the memory pressure on the undercloud is
actually not bad now, so there is not too much risk in hitting
issues where more CPUs causes high memory consumption.

This also increases the default in the HA configuration by the same
factor (2x).

Change-Id: I44f34827774353f9f70e7fd51c524567914059ab

commit_message:
Add base constraint so gnocchi metricd is tied to core-clone

Currently if we manually restart the cluster saometimes gnocchi statsd
doesnt comeup as galera is not up yet. This should tie the metrics to
core and follow the order.

Closes-bug: #1604860

Change-Id: I37117c1d8fda621c4ccb975b5074d5e5044c3b0f

subject: Refactor run-playbooks
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-25 14:06:25.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/run-playbooks.sh', 'scripts/gate-check-commit.sh', 'releasenotes/notes/run-playbooks-refactor-c89400feb692cd91.yaml'], 'message': 'Refactor run-playbooks

This changes the run playbooks script so that its using our core CLI
tools and is no longer a special case script running bits outside of
simply running the deployment tools as they've been designed.

The script is still executing all of the playbooks using the
"scripts-library" function ``install_bits`` so that we ensure gate
success by having a retry on a playbook execution in the case of transient
failure.

A notice has been added to the script whenever it exits notifying
the deployer that they should now work out of the playbooks directory
and never execute the run-playbooks.sh script ever again. Within the
notice links to our documentation have been added.

The ironic services were removed from the integrated gate because they're
not ready for general consumption and not being tested at this time because
no test configuration has been added into the tempest role or the
``run-tempest.sh`` script.

Change-Id: I064c1c480d261a885666b7dc3edc4cd0769876a6
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 9be0662c4f79783d4db8736b89bbd38063635067)
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor run-playbooks

This changes the run playbooks script so that its using our core CLI
tools and is no longer a special case script running bits outside of
simply running the deployment tools as they've been designed.

The script is still executing all of the playbooks using the
"scripts-library" function ``install_bits`` so that we ensure gate
success by having a retry on a playbook execution in the case of transient
failure.

A notice has been added to the script whenever it exits notifying
the deployer that they should now work out of the playbooks directory
and never execute the run-playbooks.sh script ever again. Within the
notice links to our documentation have been added.

The ironic services were removed from the integrated gate because they're
not ready for general consumption and not being tested at this time because
no test configuration has been added into the tempest role or the
``run-tempest.sh`` script.

Change-Id: I064c1c480d261a885666b7dc3edc4cd0769876a6
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 9be0662c4f79783d4db8736b89bbd38063635067)

commit_message:
Use zpne_start and zone_end in NXActionCT

Due to a change in ryu API, zone_ofs_bits is replaced with zone_start
and zone_end. This change reflects that, and uses the new parameters in
stead of the old one

Change-Id: I0ad93ffbfec2340a1b23a60a13ffa099e4b4dd54
Closes-Bug: 1599367

commit_message:
Python 3: dict.iteritems()

Replace dict.iteritems() with dict.items(). The Python 3 dict
type has no iteritems() method, the old iteritems() method was
renamed to items().

Change-Id: I16c3dc5d56c074097d7cdda6635796cdc9d851e3

commit_message:
Pass Qualitative Requirements separately in a Request

Add a new 'requirements' parameter to the Nova API for passing in the
qualitative features that are needed for the VM instead of continuing to
stuff those values into a flavor's extra_specs field.

Blueprint: add-qualitative-requirements

Change-Id: I2298b4e991c7eb53eeddf35241dc735f41f34fb8

subject: Make our docker-image more user-friendly
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-26 13:36:27.000000000', 'files': ['Dockerfile'], 'message': 'Make our docker-image more user-friendly

- move from ubuntu:14.04 base image to ubuntu:16.04 .
  Ubuntu 16.04 is current/latest LTS release. Let's use it.

- pre-install vim
  It is a "feaute request". Users like to experiment and modify samples
  inside container.

- pre-install bash-completion
  Rally provides bash-completion script, but uit doesn't work without
  installed `bash-completion` package.

- remove '-e' from execution of `echo`.
  This flag is not required, even more it is redundant.

- add sudo rights to rally user
  Rally is a pluggable framework. External plugins can require installation
  of additional python or system packages.

Change-Id: I9540343adbb48fded5531bd3c819396cdb7328df
'}]
commit_message:
Make our docker-image more user-friendly

- move from ubuntu:14.04 base image to ubuntu:16.04 .
  Ubuntu 16.04 is current/latest LTS release. Let's use it.

- pre-install vim
  It is a "feaute request". Users like to experiment and modify samples
  inside container.

- pre-install bash-completion
  Rally provides bash-completion script, but uit doesn't work without
  installed `bash-completion` package.

- remove '-e' from execution of `echo`.
  This flag is not required, even more it is redundant.

- add sudo rights to rally user
  Rally is a pluggable framework. External plugins can require installation
  of additional python or system packages.

Change-Id: I9540343adbb48fded5531bd3c819396cdb7328df

'}]
commit_message:
Add v2/quotas

This adds the quotas api from /admin to /v2 with some changes.

All users can GET /v2/quotas/<project_id>

Users with "All-Projects" permission can view other projects
(by setting X-Auth-All-Projects:True in the HTTP Headers)

Users with "All-Projects" and "set-quotas" can set other
projects quotas

Moved the API rendering to Designate Object based rendering

Change-Id: I7a0b828824ad6f274d922748f5f9a68157cd939a
Depends-On: I06180a7402fc45940d4b312666cf2dfd33af1305
(cherry picked from commit 619b4753cdbbbc9764c86e2d3f9780f48bcb4dd0)

Change-Id: I67bb3354162d6e0e00fa2788edde864cc14920ee

commit_message:
Migrate API reference into tree

The API Documentation team has requires [1] that
projects maintain their api-reference in-tree and
build it to the developer.openstack.org website.

This version of the API reference uses os-api-ref
and compiles API documentation close to that of
the OpenStack compute service (nova).

Co-Authored-By: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthamr@netapp.com>

[0] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-May/093765.html

Implements: bp move-manila-api-reference-in-tree
Change-Id: I67bb3354162d6e0e00fa2788edde864cc14920ee

commit_message:
Handle diskless hardware connected to remote iscsi

It is required to issue iscsistart -b on those hardware in order for
/dev/sda /dev/sdb etc to be exposed to the OS.

On this type of hw, without the fix
introspection fails with -  missing: ['local_gb']' err.

Change-Id: If6667b123e9b890d97c03612596fb78ee2b0ae85
Closes-Bug: 1590606

subject: Squash E006 bashate warnings
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-21 15:22:03.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Squash E006 bashate warnings

bashate, which is invoked when running 'tox -epep8', currently
emits many 'E006: Line too long' warnings.  We apparently don't
really care about line length in shell scripts and ignore these
warnings.

This commit instructs bashate to suppress these warnings so that
we can see any warnings that we really care about.

Change-Id: I565aeaef1f0590e5a6ee6a866974765c748f2965
"}]
commit_message:
Squash E006 bashate warnings

bashate, which is invoked when running 'tox -epep8', currently
emits many 'E006: Line too long' warnings.  We apparently don't
really care about line length in shell scripts and ignore these
warnings.

This commit instructs bashate to suppress these warnings so that
we can see any warnings that we really care about.

Change-Id: I565aeaef1f0590e5a6ee6a866974765c748f2965

commit_message:
Make it so federated tokens are validated on v2.0

This makes it so that when we validate a fernet federated token against v2.0
and raise an Unauthorized exception.

This is an effort to break https://review.openstack.org/#/c/258650 into
smaller, more reviewable pieces.

Co-Authored-By: Raildo Mascena <raildo@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Adam Young <ayound@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I321e9e72bb31617b4ecf8ba1e0171dfc099b88c7
Partial-Bug: 1561054

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-25 19:40:10.000000000', 'files': ['nova/conf/api.py'], 'message': 'Deprecate network quota configuration

The quota_networks option is only used for the os-tenant-networks
API which only supports CRUD operations for nova-network which
is deprecated, so this change deprecates the quota_networks option.

Furthermore, tenant network quota is disabled by default due to
the enable_network_quota option, so we also deprecate that option
here.

Change-Id: I892855ccf8ae83c0bd5e2bc25ea64dee83ab79ed
'}]
commit_message:
Deprecate network quota configuration

The quota_networks option is only used for the os-tenant-networks
API which only supports CRUD operations for nova-network which
is deprecated, so this change deprecates the quota_networks option.

Furthermore, tenant network quota is disabled by default due to
the enable_network_quota option, so we also deprecate that option
here.

Change-Id: I892855ccf8ae83c0bd5e2bc25ea64dee83ab79ed

subject: Use assertEqual() instead of assertDictEqual()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-26 09:16:39.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/tests/unit/test_session.py', 'keystoneclient/tests/unit/v3/test_projects.py', 'keystoneclient/tests/unit/utils.py'], 'message': "Use assertEqual() instead of assertDictEqual()

OpenStack now has dropped support for python 2.6 and lower.
So we don't need to define an assertDictEqual() for python
lower than 2.7.

Further, assertEqual() in testtools is able to handle dicts
comparation, just the same as assertDictEqual() in unittest2.
So we do't need to call assertDictEqual() for dicts any more.

Please also refer to: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/347097/

Change-Id: Ieaf211617c38aa0f9a38625b1009c36bd6a16fba
"}]
commit_message:
Use assertEqual() instead of assertDictEqual()

OpenStack now has dropped support for python 2.6 and lower.
So we don't need to define an assertDictEqual() for python
lower than 2.7.

Further, assertEqual() in testtools is able to handle dicts
comparation, just the same as assertDictEqual() in unittest2.
So we do't need to call assertDictEqual() for dicts any more.

Please also refer to: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/347097/

Change-Id: Ieaf211617c38aa0f9a38625b1009c36bd6a16fba

subject: Stop checking return of ensure_api_responding
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-26 12:31:46.000000000', 'files': ['src/lib/charm/openstack/designate.py'], 'message': 'Stop checking return of ensure_api_responding

The last commit switched ensure_api_responding from returning True
to returning nothing but create_initial_servers_and_domains is still
gating on the return code of ensure_api_responding before creating
domains so they are never created.

Change-Id: Ib3b1590c2c7b625a88e7dfb1e84183a279830dd6
'}]
commit_message:
Stop checking return of ensure_api_responding

The last commit switched ensure_api_responding from returning True
to returning nothing but create_initial_servers_and_domains is still
gating on the return code of ensure_api_responding before creating
domains so they are never created.

Change-Id: Ib3b1590c2c7b625a88e7dfb1e84183a279830dd6

commit_message:
Add debug testenv in tox

Once we add debug testenv, we can use "tox -e debug -- --debug"
to debug test cases when tox is running.

Change-Id: I5cd64bd78031ac090a6ffee1b71d329647f19230

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-24 17:54:40.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Modified oslo.i18n to 2.1.0

In 2.1.0 oslo.i18n introduced "Support contextual and plural form of
gettext functions" in commit 9e3132bc2f06da87b5c78257a267c5431f433e74.

oslo.i18n's doc also introduce the new two fuctions.[1], and
oslo.service import the two functions(not used), so we need bump
oslo.i18n to 2.1.0.

[1]http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/usage.html#creating-an-integration-module

commit_message:
Modified oslo.i18n to 2.1.0

In 2.1.0 oslo.i18n introduced "Support contextual and plural form of
gettext functions" in commit 9e3132bc2f06da87b5c78257a267c5431f433e74.

oslo.i18n's doc also introduce the new two fuctions.[1], and
oslo.service import the two functions(not used), so we need bump
oslo.i18n to 2.1.0.

[1]http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/usage.html#creating-an-integration-module
Closes-bug: #1525992

Change-Id: I318898c651f02d21949e738d690cefce01bfff84

subject: Fix X-*-Container-Update-Override-* header/footer precedence
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-07 00:22:48.000000000', 'files': ['swift/obj/server.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_server.py'], 'message': "Fix X-*-Container-Update-Override-* header/footer precedence

Previously, all footer overrides (whether from the X-Backend-* or
X-Object-Sysmeta-* namespace) would take priority over any header
override.

However, middleware should be able to set a Sysmeta override without
needing to worry about whether it's working with a replicated policy
(where setting it in headers will suffice) or an EC policy (where it
would need to install a footers callback). This could be mitigated by
*always* installing a footer callback, but doing so would incur
additional overhead that would otherwise be unnecessary.

Change-Id: Idb40361ac72da51e1390dff690723dbc2c653a13
"}]
commit_message:
Fix X-*-Container-Update-Override-* header/footer precedence

Previously, all footer overrides (whether from the X-Backend-* or
X-Object-Sysmeta-* namespace) would take priority over any header
override.

However, middleware should be able to set a Sysmeta override without
needing to worry about whether it's working with a replicated policy
(where setting it in headers will suffice) or an EC policy (where it
would need to install a footers callback). This could be mitigated by
*always* installing a footer callback, but doing so would incur
additional overhead that would otherwise be unnecessary.

Change-Id: Idb40361ac72da51e1390dff690723dbc2c653a13

commit_message:
Using LOG.warning replace LOG.warn

Python 3 deprecated the logger.warn method, see:
https://docs.python.org/3/library/logging.html#logging.warning
so we prefer to use warning to avoid DeprecationWarning.
Closes-bug:#15229913

Change-Id: Ia5c49fb7ec1327fb995b94844bc548ee9afd3da4

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-12-29 06:04:30.000000000', 'files': ['glance/api/v2/image_data.py', 'glance/tests/unit/v1/test_upload_utils.py', 'glance/api/v2/images.py', 'glance/api/v1/upload_utils.py', 'glance/tests/unit/v2/test_images_resource.py', 'glance/tests/unit/v2/test_image_data_resource.py'], 'message': "BackendException from glancestore causes 500 Error

Location metadata validation is performed in glance store
which is raising BackendExecption if metadata value is not
unicode, dict or list. This exception is not caught in glance
which results in raising 500 error.

Now, when the storage back-end raise BackendException error, Glance
doesn't catch it and raise 500 error. Such as if there is no enough
space for image store, the back-end(Such as Swift) will sometimes
raise a BackendException error.

This patch catch this error when upload image data and update method
and raising HTTPBadRequests to return 400 response to the user.

ApiImpact: For invalid location metadata value 400 response will
           be returned.

Co-Authored-By: wangxiyuan <wangxiyuan@huawei.com>
Closes-Bug: #1526641

Change-Id: Ie3916b6818260c66d9ae5de475128a8d21236aa8
"}]
commit_message:
BackendException from glancestore causes 500 Error

Location metadata validation is performed in glance store
which is raising BackendExecption if metadata value is not
unicode, dict or list. This exception is not caught in glance
which results in raising 500 error.

Now, when the storage back-end raise BackendException error, Glance
doesn't catch it and raise 500 error. Such as if there is no enough
space for image store, the back-end(Such as Swift) will sometimes
raise a BackendException error.

This patch catch this error when upload image data and update method
and raising HTTPBadRequests to return 400 response to the user.

ApiImpact: For invalid location metadata value 400 response will
           be returned.

Co-Authored-By: wangxiyuan <wangxiyuan@huawei.com>
Closes-Bug: #1526641

Change-Id: Ie3916b6818260c66d9ae5de475128a8d21236aa8

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-06-21 13:19:41.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/metadata/agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/metadata/test_agent.py'], 'message': 'Move state reporting initialization to after worker forking

We start state reporting thread before forking child processes. This
leads to possibility of fork in the middle of reporting process. This
can cause child processes to start with corrupted global state. In [0]
it represented itself as metadata agent not being able to make RPC call
because of lock acquired in main process before fork and released after
fork. See bug description for details.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/312393

Partial-Bug: 1594439

Change-Id: Id5079a296bc402c6f5b6cdb2df72811eab5bc6ed
'}]
commit_message:
Move state reporting initialization to after worker forking

We start state reporting thread before forking child processes. This
leads to possibility of fork in the middle of reporting process. This
can cause child processes to start with corrupted global state. In [0]
it represented itself as metadata agent not being able to make RPC call
because of lock acquired in main process before fork and released after
fork. See bug description for details.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/312393

Partial-Bug: 1594439

Change-Id: Id5079a296bc402c6f5b6cdb2df72811eab5bc6ed

admin, auth, publicURL, internalURL, adminURL], any other value will
raise ValueError.

commit_message:
Add test for nova-compute and nova-network main database blocks

We block the database objects when conductor is not local for compute
and network, but we don't test this code anywhere because it's in the
main() function of the actual executable.

Fix that.

virt/hardware: Add diagnostic logs for scheduling

There are many reasons why booting a pinned instance can fail. Expose
some of these reasons to operators via the logs.

Change-Id: Id99cca56df93573b0a0a192cbaf198d059c78e88

commit_message:

This change incorrectly modified an existing correct plural usage of
infrastructure into an incorrect attempt as "infrastructures."

This reverts commit f19141b9b16cf4a37a2044000d5ff1dfd2e403f7.

Change-Id: I5d9f725f60c8762017107ef55398b844efa9dec0

commit_message:
Fix wrong licenses for fuel-release and fuel-setup subpackages

Licenses for these two packages were set to GPLv2 for no apparent
reason. Align the licenses for subpackages with the fuel-main
package license.

Change-Id: Id8dd332216c91cc1f122db5c27a87bae0d4db18d
Closes-Bug: #1597696
(cherry picked from commit db63658d12d849f3b04b8d62c9f4e8c5d4411fb0)

Fix opt description and check deprecate status for hyperv.py

Removed the "Services which consume this:" sections per wiki
instructions.  Also removed the "Related options" sections
where there are no information.

Also, since there are no deprecated options the
"check_deprecation_status" flag has been removed as well.

Blueprint centralize-config-options-newton

subject: Allow extra LXC command options via group/host vars
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-07-26 10:25:15.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test-containers-functional.yml', 'tasks/container_create.yml', 'tests/host_vars/container1.yml', 'defaults/main.yml', 'releasenotes/notes/container-create-commands-b3aa578309fa665b.yaml'], 'message': 'Allow extra LXC command options via group/host vars

To reduce the number of times a container is restarted during the
build process, this patch implements the facility to consume
LXC container_command items from the inventory.

This allows any arbitrary command, such as the creation of a bind
mount directory, to be set in group_vars and therefore have it
applied on container creation instead of later when the service
install playbook runs.

Change-Id: I2aa015a136d6efca501797430d82f1461c303edf
'}]
commit_message:
Allow extra LXC command options via group/host vars

To reduce the number of times a container is restarted during the
build process, this patch implements the facility to consume
LXC container_command items from the inventory.

This allows any arbitrary command, such as the creation of a bind
mount directory, to be set in group_vars and therefore have it
applied on container creation instead of later when the service
install playbook runs.

Change-Id: I2aa015a136d6efca501797430d82f1461c303edf

commit_message:
Fix opt description for scheduler.py

Removed the 'Services that use...' as per [0].
Also, there are no deprecated options in this file, so the
'check_deprecation_status' flag has been removed, too.

[0] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ConfigOptionsConsistency

Blueprint centralize-config-options-newton

Change-Id: Ic9edf054a3431a02717ade93a92d4b0e7fd8ac81

subject: Use assertEqual() instead of assertDictEqual()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-25 07:26:01.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/tests/common/test_parseractions.py', 'openstackclient/tests/compute/v2/test_server.py'], 'message': 'Use assertEqual() instead of assertDictEqual()

In unittest2, assertDictEqual() is implemented by
using != operator to compare two dicts. So is
assertEqual() in testtools. assertEqual() in
testtools is able to handle dict, list, set and
so on. So we just call assertEqual() to make the
unit tests simpler.

Change-Id: Ice343b2ce468acae39d2ad79f7121503e3627656
'}]
commit_message:
Use assertEqual() instead of assertDictEqual()

In unittest2, assertDictEqual() is implemented by
using != operator to compare two dicts. So is
assertEqual() in testtools. assertEqual() in
testtools is able to handle dict, list, set and
so on. So we just call assertEqual() to make the
unit tests simpler.

Change-Id: Ice343b2ce468acae39d2ad79f7121503e3627656

commit_message:
Use pop instead del

For example:resp.pop(a,None), when a is in resp, resp will delete key and value
of a. When a is not in resp, None is returned.

Change-Id: I12892e6dc8b37fe49e9ec8cbeadab219793a25e9

commit_message:

commit_message:
Fix parameters of assertEqual are misplaced

Many assertEqual sentences don't follow assertEqual(expected, actual),
These misplaces have 2 impacts:
1, giving confusing messages when some tests failed.
2, mislead other developers, new test modules may follow these wrong pattern.

This patch fix all of them.

Change-Id: Icc6e404dd02fe47b76c7366d31d91c8d8e464f54
Closes-Bug: #1604213

commit_message:
Added an automatic get token plug-ins.

  Getting token is a necessary action, so an automatic get token
  plug-ins should be integrated into heatclient.
  Old API still used:
   >> heat = Client(version, endpoint=heat_url, token=auth_token)
  You can get a token automaticlly now:
   >> heat = Client(version, username='username', password='password',
   endpoint=heat_url, auth_url='auth_url')

Change-Id: Ic33303b8d41a84542b38cc51963ff2abb84adcbc
